title:
Simplicial Cheeger-Simons models and simplicial higher abelian gauge
  theory
abstract:
A Cheeger-Simons triangulation $(K, K')$ of a compact smooth oriented
Riemannian manifold $M$ gives rise to a Cheeger-Simons model, which defines a
finite dimensional differential character group
$\mbox{Diff}^{\bullet}(\mathscr{CS}(K, K'))$. This group converges to the
ordinary Cheeger-Simons differential character group
$\widehat{H}^{\bullet}(M)$. We introduce a simplicial higher abelian gauge
theory based on Cheeger-Simons models and demonstrate that, as the mesh
approaches zero, the partition function of this theory converges to the one
proposed by Kelnhofer in \cite{K2}.
